title: Arsenal midfielder sheds light on his future after departure rumours
body_text:
Jorginho has shed some light on his future at Arsenal after rumours about his potential departure emerged.
The Italian joined the Gunners in January, taking the short, well-travelled road from Chelsea.
The midfielder is one of many players to make the switch and as things stand, has been one of the rare successes.
Although not the preferred starter, Jorginho has been an adequate replacement for Thomas Partey when the Ghanaian has been injured and adds a lot of experience to a young dressing room.
Unlikely to cement a first-eleven spot in Mikel Arteta’s side, the 31-year-old has been subject to links away from the club.
Jorginho’s contract expires at the end of the season and he touched on his future in London during Arsenal’s Champions League press conference on Tuesday.
“No I haven’t had any conversations to be honest.” he said via Football.London.
“All I can say is that I feel really good here. I’m really happy at Arsenal. I haven’t thought about it to be honest with you.”
The midfielder returned to his old stomping grounds on Saturday but failed to make his mark during the homecoming as Arsenal struggled to a 2-2 draw.
He will be in contention to start against Sevilla tomorrow night.
